intro: Selliguea cruciformis, commonly known as the cruciform moss, is a species of liverwort belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is characterized by its intricate, branching structure that forms a cross-like pattern, giving it its common name. This plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and rock crevices. Its leaves are closely arranged and often have a distinct, elongated shape. Selliguea cruciformis plays a role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for microorganisms in its ecosystem.
